lead_paragraph: Broad majorities of Republican primary voters say they believe the party is divided, are embarrassed by the party’s presidential campaign and consider a contested convention to be bad for the party. Democratic primary voters say their party is much more unified, but their race is tighter, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

headline.main: A New York Times/CBS News Poll on What Voters Think About the Campaign

snippet: Broad majorities of Republican primary voters say they believe the party is divided, are embarrassed by the party’s presidential campaign and consider a contested convention to be bad for the party. Democratic primary voters say their party is much more unified, but their race is tighter, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.
